title: Nuclear Industry Expert Larry W. Camper Joins SECUR Board Of Directors
text:
PITTSBURGH, Feb. 13, 2018 /PRNewswire/ -- SECUR ( www.securllc.com ), provider of transportation logistics, packaging and technical services for radioactive, hazardous and non-hazardous waste and byproducts, announced today that Larry W. Camper joined its Board of Directors.
Mr. Camper is a health physicist, radiation safety expert, environmental remediation expert and executive with more than 40 years of professional experience in both the private and public sectors of the nuclear industry. He retired in 2015 as Director of the Division of Decommissioning, Uranium Recovery and Waste Program of US Nuclear Regulatory Commission.
"Larry's insight will be invaluable to SECUR," said John Evanko, SECUR president. "We look forward to leveraging his expertise in nuclear safety and environmental protection to make our vision of safe and compliant solutions for our radioactive waste clients a reality."
Mr. Camper said, "I believe in SECUR and in John's vision. I've known John for many years. I'm confident in his team's ability to develop innovative solutions for the unique challenges of the nuclear industry."
In addition to Mr. Camper's seat on the SECUR board, he serves on the Board of Directors for the Waste Management Symposia, where he also is a member of the Program Advisory Committee. He was elected a Fellow of the Waste Management Symposia in recognition of his long-standing service to the organization. He received the 2016 Sarge Ozker Award presented by the Nuclear Engineering Division-Radwaste Systems Operating Committee of the American Society of Mechanical Engineers and the 2010 Richard S. Hodes, MD Honor Lecture Award presented by the Southeast Compact Commission.
Mr. Camper is President and Executive Consultant with Advoco Professional Services, LLC and a Senior Nuclear Consultant for Talisman International, LLC.
Media contact: Danielle Scherer, 412-506-8250 Ext. 104, danielle.scherer@securllc.com
ABOUT SECUR
SECUR provides clients in industry and government with asset-based logistics, packaging and technical services that enable them safely and cost efficiently to handle a range of radioactive, hazardous, industrial and other complex wastes generated from environmental remediation, decommissioning and waste management activities.
